definition: Lord Bao or Judge Bao, fictional nickname of Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Bao

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
lit. briefcase company/dummy corporation/shell company/fly-by-night company

sentences.english: This paper company does fictitious transactions exclusively.
sentences.chinese: 这个皮包公司专做买空卖空的生意。

sentences.english: Chaper Four, image of Baogong in Baogong Dramas.
sentences.chinese: 第四章，包公戏中的包公形象。

sentences.english: Chaper Four, image of Baogong in Baogong Dramas.
sentences.chinese: 第四章，包公戏中的包公形象。

sentences.english: Don't believe any fly-by-night company, they all lack credibility.
sentences.chinese: 皮包公司的信誉值得我们相信吗？

sentences.english: After getting at the officials in charge, a shell company was finally awarded the highway contract.
sentences.chinese: 勾兑了负责官员后皮包公司终于拿到了高速公路合同。

sentences.english: Suddenly, Lord Bao's eyes lit up.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，包公的眼睛亮了起来。

sentences.english: The people called Lord Bao "Bao the Clear Sky".
sentences.chinese: 老百姓管包公叫包青天。

sentences.english: Can we believe in the credibility of fly-by-night companies?
sentences.chinese: 皮包公司的信誉值得我们相信吗？

sentences.english: "resentment and! anger Bao Gong, "paper-cut king cried out uncontrollably.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的包公”剪纸王失声喊出来。

sentences.english: He said as he bowed down before Lord Bao. And then he turned around and ran back home.
sentences.chinese: 他说着向包公鞠了一躬，转身跑回家去了。

sentences.english: This well was originally called Bao well.

definition: Bao Zheng (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty/modern day metaphor for an honest politician

Bao Qingtian, fictional nickname of Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty
popular nickname of Hai Rui 海瑞[Hai3 Rui4] (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity
upright and honest
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Hai Rui (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity
Hairui township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
honest and upright official (traditional)
upright and plainspoken
Kaifeng as the capital of Northern Song dynasty
Lord Guan (i.e. 關羽|关羽[Guan1 Yu3])
a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
Yang Saga, a popular fiction from the Northern Song, depicting the heroic Yang family 楊業|杨业 of warriors
lever-style guillotine decorated with a dragon's head at the hinged end, used to behead criminals related to the emperor
to maintain the law as firm as a mountain (idiom); to enforce the law strictly
